clinical_study.brief_title: Reduce Immunosuppression With Atmp in NS ChildrEn
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Open-label Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of Allogeneic Human Cord Blood-derived Mesenchymal Stromal Cells in Maintaining Remission After Immunosuppressive Therapy Withdrawal in Pediatric Patients With Steroid-dependent Nephrotic Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione IRCCS Ca' Granda, Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico

collaborator.agency: Cell Factory Fondazione IRCCS Ca' Granda Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico
Laboratorio Sperimentale di Immunologia e Trapianti, Oncoematologia Pediatrica, Fondazione IRCCS Policlinico S. Matteo, Pavia

clinical_study.source: Fondazione IRCCS Ca' Granda, Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico

brief_summary.textblock:
A phase II open-label, single arm study aimed to ascertain whether infusions of cord-blood mesenchymal stromal cells (CB-MSCs) allow to reduce or suspend the chronic immunosuppressive therapy (IS) in steroid-dependent nephrotic syndrome (SDNS).
We plan to enroll 11 patients aged 3 to 18 with SDNS in remission for at least one month, maintained by either ≥2 immunosuppressive drugs or a calcineurin inhibitor.
Patients are infused with cord-blood allogenic MSC, selected by in-vitro alloreactivity, at a dose of 1.5x10^6/kg on days 0, 14, 21. The immunosuppressive treatment is gradually tapered starting at the first CB-MSC administration, according to the following scheme: 25% following the first administration, 50% following the second administration, and 100% reduction following the third administration.
All patients will be followed-up for 6 months from the last CB-MSC. Study visits are planned at baseline during CB-MSC administrations, 2 weeks (follow-up [FU]1) and 6 weeks (FU2) after the last infusion, and then every 6 weeks. During follow-up, the patients undergo a physical examination (including measurement of height, weight and blood pressure) and laboratory evaluations (urinary protein:urinary creatinine ratio, complete blood count, kidney function, plasma proteins, liver function, triglycerides and cholesterol). In addition, a blood sample is taken for regulatory T lymphocyte quantification, a marker of clinical response to the infusions.

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of patients without nephrotic syndrome recurrence after complete withdrawal of immunosuppressive treatment for at least 6 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months following completion of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients without nephrotic-range proteinuria as measured by the urinary protein to urinary creatinine ratio (uPr/uCr<2) 6 months after completing the intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months following completion of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: As described by the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events

secondary_outcome.measure: The time to recurrence of nephrotic syndrome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 6 months from the completion of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by the ratio of urinary protein to urinary creatinine

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage of participants achieving a reduction in the immunosuppressive therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months following completion of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Reduction of the ongoing immunosuppressive treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The dose of immunosuppressive therapy to prevent further NS relapses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months following completion of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The minimal dose of immunosuppressive therapy necessary to maintain the patient in remission following the therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months following completion of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in quality of life as reported by the patients and/or parents

intervention.description: The product is packaged in bags suitable for the cryopreservation of cell products. Before administration the cells must be thawed and diluted in an appropriate vol:vol solution: made by saline 78%, human albumin 10%, Acyl-CoA dehydrogenase-A (ACD-A) 12%.

facility.name: Pediatric Nephrology, Dialysis and Transplant Unit, Fondazione IRCCS Ca' Granda Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico Milan

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fondazione IRCCS Ca' Granda, Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico

clinical_study.keyword: Steroid Dependent Nephrotic Syndrome in Children
